alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 5:13PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Mono. * WHEN...Until 815 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 513 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Highway 6 south of Benton. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Highway 6 south of Benton is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Mono County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
